item.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="06680" class="">Command</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> to <st data-num="07971" class="">expel</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="06879" class="">leper</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">everyone</st> who <st data-num="02100" class="">has a discharge</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">whoever</st> becomes <st data-num="02931" class="">defiled</st> by a <st data-num="05315" class="">corpse</st>.<n id="4" />

You must <st data-num="07971" class="">expel</st> both <st data-num="02145" class="">men</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">and</st> <st data-num="05347" class="">women</st>; you must <st data-num="07971" class="">put</st> them <st data-num="0413 02351">outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>, so that<n id="1" /> they will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02930" class="">defile</st> their <st data-num="04264" class="">camps</st>, <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="07931" class="">live</st>.”
So the Israelites did so, and expelled them outside the camp. As the Lord had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
“Tell the Israelites, ‘When a man or a woman commits any sin that people commit, thereby breaking faith with the Lord, and that person is found guilty,

then he must <st data-num="03034" class="">confess</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="02403" class="">sin</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he has <st data-num="06213" class="">committed</st> and must <st data-num="07725" class="">make</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">full</st> <st data-num="0817" class="">reparation</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03254" class="">add</st> <st data-num="02549" class="">one-fifth</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> it, and <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> it to <st data-num="0834" class="">whomever</st> he <st data-num="0816" class="">wronged</st>.<n id="3" />

But if the individual has no close relative to whom reparation can be made for the wrong, the reparation for the wrong must be paid to the Lord for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement by which atonement is made for him.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Every</st> <st data-num="08641" class="">offering</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites’</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy things</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> they <st data-num="07126" class="">bring</st> to the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> his.
Every man’s holy things will be his; whatever any man gives the priest will be his.’”
The Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="01696" class="">Speak</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">tell</st> them, ‘<st data-num="03588" class="">If</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> <st data-num="07847" class="">goes astray</st> and <st data-num="04603" class="">behaves</st> <st data-num="04604" class="">unfaithfully</st> toward him,

and a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="07901" class="">goes to bed</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> her for <st data-num="07902 02233">sexual relations</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05956" class="">without</st> her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">knowing</st> it,<n id="2" /> and it is <st data-num="05641" class="">undetected</st> that <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> has <st data-num="02930" class="">defiled</st> herself since<n id="3" /> there was <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> <st data-num="05707" class="">witness</st> against her, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> was <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> <st data-num="08610" class="">caught</st> in the act—

and if <st data-num="07068" class="">jealous</st> <st data-num="07307" class="">feelings</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05674" class="">come</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> him and he <st data-num="07065" class="">becomes suspicious of</st><n id="2" /> his <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> when <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> <st data-num="02930" class="">is defiled</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> if <st data-num="07068" class="">jealous</st> <st data-num="07307" class="">feelings</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">come</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> him and he <st data-num="07065" class="">becomes suspicious of</st> his <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>, when <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> <st data-num="02930" class="">is</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02930" class="">defiled</st>—

then the man must bring his wife to the priest, and he must bring the offering required for her, one-tenth of an ephah of barley meal; he must not pour olive oil on it or put frankincense on it because it is a grain offering of suspicion, a grain offering for remembering, for bringing iniquity to remembrance.
“‘Then the priest will bring her near and have her stand before the Lord.

The <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will then <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="06918" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st><n id="1" /> in a <st data-num="02789" class="">pottery</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">jar</st>, and <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">some</st><n id="2" /> of the <st data-num="06083" class="">dust</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> on the <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> of the <st data-num="04908" class="">tabernacle</st>, and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.

Then the priest will have the woman stand before the Lord, and he will uncover the woman’s head and put the grain offering for remembering in her hands, which is the grain offering of suspicion. The priest will hold in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.

Then the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="07650" class="">put</st> the woman <st data-num="07650" class="">under oath</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">her</st>, “<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> other<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="07901" class="">has gone to bed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you, and <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> you have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07847" class="">gone astray</st> and become <st data-num="02932" class="">defiled</st> while <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> your <st data-num="0376" class="">husband’s</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">authority</st>, may you <st data-num="05352" class="">be free</st> from <st data-num="0428" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04751" class="">bitter</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> that <st data-num="0779" class="">brings a curse</st>.<n id="3" />

But <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st><n id="1" /> have <st data-num="07847" class="">gone astray</st> while <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> your <st data-num="0376" class="">husband’s</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">authority</st>, and <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> you have <st data-num="02930" class="">defiled</st> yourself and some <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="01107" class="">other than</st> your <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> has <st data-num="05414" class="">had</st> <st data-num="07903" class="">sexual relations</st><n id="2" /> with you—”<n id="3" />

(then the priest will put the woman under the oath of the curse and will say to her) “the Lord make you an attested curse among your people if the Lord makes your thigh fall away and your abdomen swell,
and this water that causes the curse will go into your stomach and make your abdomen swell and your thigh rot.” Then the woman must say, “Amen, amen.”
“‘Then the priest will write these curses on a scroll and then scrape them off into the bitter water.

He will make the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">drink</st> the <st data-num="04751" class="">bitter</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> that <st data-num="0779" class="">brings a curse</st>, and the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> that <st data-num="0779" class="">brings a curse</st> will <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> her to produce <st data-num="04751" class="">bitterness</st>.
The priest will take the grain offering of suspicion from the woman’s hand, wave the grain offering before the Lord, and bring it to the altar.

Then the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="07061" class="">take a handful</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st> as its <st data-num="0234" class="">memorial portion</st>, <st data-num="06999" class="">burn</st> it on the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, and <st data-num="0310" class="">afterward</st> make the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">drink</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.

When he has made her <st data-num="08248" class="">drink</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, <st data-num="01961" class="">then</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> she has <st data-num="02930" class="">defiled</st> herself and <st data-num="04603" class="">behaved</st> <st data-num="04604" class="">unfaithfully</st> toward her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st>, the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> that <st data-num="0779" class="">brings a curse</st> will <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> her to produce <st data-num="04751" class="">bitterness</st>—her <st data-num="0990" class="">abdomen</st> will <st data-num="06638" class="">swell</st>, her <st data-num="03409" class="">thigh</st> will <st data-num="05307" class="">fall away</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> a <st data-num="0423" class="">curse</st> <st data-num="07130" class="">among</st> her <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>.
But if the woman has not defiled herself, and is clean, then she will be free of ill effects and will be able to bear children.
“‘This is the law for cases of jealousy, when a wife, while under her husband’s authority, goes astray and defiles herself,
or when jealous feelings come over a man and he becomes suspicious of his wife; then he must have the woman stand before the Lord, and the priest will carry out all this law upon her.
Then the man will be free from iniquity, but that woman will bear the consequences of her iniquity.’”
